message: @mistahsnart rather than the hard and annoying way like normal? ;-)
It really allowed me to be annoying in a lot of interesting ways. Images, video, audio... it really let me bug the beejesus out of people in an easy and fun way.
Among the many awesome things about Pownce, I really loved how versatile it was; easy to converse and connect with people, easy to share short or long messages, etc...etc...etc..
The length of the typical posts were pretty nice, since there was enough space to really get your thought out and still have room for people to comment to contribute to the discussion.
My favorite part about Pownce? All the awesome people of course!
Though it really came down to the awesome community...made some of my first connections with other photographers on Pownce, always full of people that had actual, interesting stuff to talk about.
My favorite feature on Pownce? My posts. I'm with @mistahsnart.
Daniel Burka's three column design was pretty groovy.
@herbg totally, the community was just legendary!
It was a combination of things I really loved about Pownce. The length of posts, ability to attach, the community. It was a perfect mix of features.
My favorite feature was being able to target a message to a group of people and not being broadcasting my messages to everyone on earth.
@qrcd +1 and the media sharing was epic too
def. the media sharing. I loved the in browser player too.
I myself have to go with the media sharing feature as well.
